IDBOpenDBRequest.summary: The IDBOpenDBRequest interface of the IndexedDB API provides access to the results of requests to open or delete databases (performed using and ), using specific event handler attributes.

remarks.para:
-Using IndexedDB
-Starting transactions:
-Using transactions:
-Setting a range of keys:
-Retrieving and making changes to your data:
-Using cursors:
-Reference example: To-do Notifications (View the example live).

IDBOpenDBRequestBlocked.summary: The blocked handler is executed when an open connection to a database is blocking a versionchange transaction on the same database.

remarks.para: This event is not cancelable and does not bubble.

IDBOpenDBRequestUpgradeneeded.summary: The upgradeneeded event is fired when an attempt was made to open a database with a version number higher than its current version.

remarks.para: This event is not cancelable and does not bubble.
